oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Gertrude Bugler to Mrs Hardy — Declining the role of “Tess”, 4 February 1925
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gertrude Bugler
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Mrs Hardy (recipient); Thomas Hardy referenced (VIAF: https://viaf.org/viaf/49245702)
oai_dc:dc.dc:format: Manuscript letter; ink on paper; 2 written pages (5 images incl. blanks)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bugler writes from Beaminster to decline the role of Tess, citing family reasons and suggesting that Miss Thorndike may later produce the play to greater success.
oai_dc:dc.dcterms:provenance: Held by Dorset History Centre / Dorset Museum.
oai_dc:dc.dcterms:rights: Rights status uncertain; consult holding repository.
